alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Delaware; Dubuque; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 12 at 11:32PM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected with snow and blowing snow tonight and Saturday morning. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph by tonight. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Illinois and east central and northeast Iowa. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, through noon CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Saturday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult and dangerous. Blowing and drifting snow tonight and Saturday morning will likely result in blizzard conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, which could lead to some power outages. For later this weekend into early next week, dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as ten minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tonight, much colder air moves in which could result in a flash freeze on roadways.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
